haxe.reactive.Signal

type
class
defined in
haxe.reactive.Reactive

Constructor

new(stream : Stream<Dynamic>, init : T, updater : Pulse<Dynamic> -> Propagation<T>)

Instance Methods

blind(time : Int) : Signal<T>

parameters
time The time to blind the stream to.
Blinds the event stream to events occurring the specified number of milliseconds together or less.

blindS(time : Signal<Int>) : Signal<T>

parameters
time The time to blind the stream to.
Blinds the event stream to events occurring the specified number of milliseconds together or less.

calm(time : Int) : Signal<T>

parameters
time The number of milliseconds.
Calms the stream. No event will be get through unless it occurs T milliseconds or more before the following event.

calmS(time : Signal<Int>) : Signal<T>

parameters
time The number of milliseconds as a Signal.
Calms the stream. No event will be get through unless it occurs T milliseconds or more before the following event.

changes() : Stream<T>

Returns the Stream underlying the Signal.

delay(time : Int) : Signal<T>

parameters
time Time in milliseconds as an Int
Delays this stream by the specified number of milliseconds.

delayS(time : Signal<Int>) : Signal<T>

parameters
time Time in milliseconds as a Signal
Delays this stream by the specified number of milliseconds.

lift<Z>(f : T -> Z) : Signal<Z>

parameters
f The function to apply.
Applies a function to a value and returns the result as a Signal.

liftS<Z>(f : Signal<T -> Z>) : Signal<Z>

parameters
f A Signal that accepts a T and returns a Z.
Applies a function to a value and returns the result as a Signal.

map<Z>(f : T -> Z) : Signal<Z>

parameters
f The function to apply.
Applies a function to a value and returns the result as a Signal.

mapC(f : Stream<T> -> Stream<T>) : Signal<T>

parameters
f The function to apply.
Applies a function to a signal's value that accepts an Stream value and returns the result as an Stream value.

mapS<Z>(f : Signal<T -> Z>) : Signal<Z>

parameters
f A Signal that accepts a T and returns a Z.
Applies a function to a value and returns the result as a Signal.

sendSignal(value : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
value the value to send Into the Stream.
Sends an event to the underlying Stream that will be immediately propagated with a new timestamp.

valueNow() : T

Returns the present value of 'this' Signal.

zip<B>(b2 : Signal<B>) : Signal<Tuple2<TB>>

parameters
b2 The Signal with which to zip 'this' Signal.
returns
A Signal Tuple slice containing an element from each supplied Signal
Zips elements of supplied Signals together and returns a Signal of Tuple2 containing the zipped elements. 1, 2, 3.zip1, 2, 3 == Tuple2[1, 1], Tuple2[2, 2], Tuple2[3, 3]

zip3<B, C>(b2 : Signal<B>, b3 : Signal<C>) : Signal<Tuple3<TBC>>

parameters
b2 A Signal to be zipped.
b3 A Signal to be zipped.
returns
A Signal Tuple slice containing an element from each Signal
Zips elements of supplied Signals together and returns a Signal of Tuple3 containing the zipped elements.

zip4<B, C, D>(b2 : Signal<B>, b3 : Signal<C>, b4 : Signal<D>) : Signal<Tuple4<TBCD>>

parameters
b2 A Signal to be zipped.
b3 A Signal to be zipped.
b4 A Signal to be zipped.
returns
A Signal Tuple slice containing an element from each Signal
Zips elements of supplied Signals together and returns a Signal of Tuple4 containing the zipped elements.

zip5<B, C, D, E>(b2 : Signal<B>, b3 : Signal<C>, b4 : Signal<D>, b5 : Signal<E>) : Signal<Tuple5<TBCDE>>

parameters
b2 A Signal to be zipped.
b3 A Signal to be zipped.
b4 A Signal to be zipped.
b5 A Signal to be zipped.
returns
A Signal Tuple slice containing an element from each Signal
Zips elements of supplied Signals together and returns a Signal of Tuple5 containing the zipped elements.

zipN(signals : Iterable<Signal<T>>) : Signal<Iterable<T>>

parameters
signals An Iterable of the Signals to be zipped.
Zips together the specified Signals.

zipWith<A, R>(b2 : Signal<A>, f : T -> A -> R) : Signal<R>

parameters
as The signal with which to zipWith 'this'.
f The function that will be used to get the result from the inputs signals ('this' and as).
returns
The Signal of the result of the application of the function on using both stream elements as input.
Zips elements of supplied streams together using a function and returns a Signal of the resulting elements. 1, 2, 3.zipWith(1, 2, 3, Tuple2.create) == Tuple2[1, 1], Tuple2[2, 2], Tuple2[3, 3]
